qas.question: How can former rivers be recognised presently?

answers.text: the streets that were built on them follow their shapes

qas.question: What is the only remaining waterway in Palermo?
Which two former rivers in Palermo are currently building sites?
What bodies of water run through Pallermo?
What follows the former course of the Oreto?
What river divides the easr and west sides of the city?

context: Today both the <a2_0><b3_0>Papireto river and the Kemonia<b3_0/><a2_0/> are covered up by buildings. However, the shape of the former watercourses can still be recognised today, because <a0_0>the <b4_0>streets<b4_0/> that were built on them follow their shapes<a0_0/>. Today the only waterway not drained yet is the <a1_0><b5_0>Oreto river<b5_0/><a1_0/> that divides the downtown of the city from the western uptown and the industrial districts. In the basins there were, though, many <b6_0>seasonal torrents<b6_0/> that helped formed swampy plains, reclaimed during history; a good example of which can be found in the borough of Mondello.
